1.subtitle: Civil Rights Act, (1964), comprehensive U.S. legislation intended to end discrimination based on race, colour, religion, or national origin.

2.title: Jarvis Boards
2.subtitle: Jarvis Boards' mission has always been to craft paddle boards in Austin, Texas that are environmentally friendly, look great, and perform well. To accomplish this, we employ a wide range of techniques to craft our small-batch production wooden SUPs in our Austin studio.

products.name: Hollow Core Paddle Board Frame Kits
products.description: There is something magical about creating something with your own two hands. Building your own hollow core paddle board will be one of the most rewarding projects that you'll tackle.

products.name: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hat
products.description: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hats aren't just for dads. This one's got a low profile with an adjustable strap and curved visor. Available in khaki and light blue.

products.name: Surf Wax Candle
products.description: We teamed up with our friends at Jimbo's Surf Wax to create a unique line of surf wax candles. Each candle is slow cooked over a wood stove in Maine using surf wax and a hint of coconut.

2.title: Divided We Fall. Ignorant We Fail.
2.subtitle: This book is a non-fiction introspective of the country’s response to the first black President.

3.title: Mutt's Sauce
3.subtitle: In 1956, Mutt got the idea to make a sauce he could use for every meal. Mutt’s sauce was a multi-purpose specialty sauce, infusing sweet, tangy and a little bit of heat into each spoonful.

products.name: Combo 3 Pack
products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

products.name: Deluxe Spices 3 Pack

products.name: Deluxe Combo Pack — Sauce + Spices
products.description: This is the ultimate gift for Cooking with Mutt's Sauce!  Try the sauces:  Gluten Free Original, Sweet N Spicy, and Ghost Pepper, as well as our new line of spices: Berbere, Garlic Ghost Pepper, and Onion Pepper.

3.title: A Content Analysis and Study of Colorism and Strides toward Inclusivity in the Cosmetic Industry
3.subtitle: The purpose of this research is twofold: 1) to explore colorism in the cosmetic industry in light of multiple marketing venues such as social media, online, and retail stores and 2) to provide a snapshot of improvement (or lack of) in shades and foundation colors offered in the beauty industry.

4.title: Why Protests and Riots Work
4.subtitle: Riots are destructive, dangerous, and scary — but can lead to serious social reforms. To prevent more violent uprisings and protests, we need to take their causes seriously.

4.title: Color of Change
4.subtitle: Color Of Change was founded in moments just like this one. As Black communities reeled in grief as all levels of government failed to protect Black people in the wake of Hurricane Katrina, we recognized that not enough of the people and institutions with power over our lives had any fear of disappointing Black people. For the last 15 years, we've focused on building that power.

5.title: Airis Foods
5.subtitle: Airis Foods are hand crafted food products that add flavor and flare to all your cooking and snacking needs. With both the home cook and the commercial chef in mind, owner Airis the Chef combines simple, wholesome ingredients to create BIG FLAVOR profiles.

5.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
5.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

6.title: BLK & Proud Forever
6.subtitle: BLK & Proud Forever was started in 2019 for a family that was in need of some custom apparel that could display their Black pride. Our goal is to provide some great BLK&Proud gear that supports, celebrates and amplifies the dopeness in being Blackity Black Black 365.

6.title: The Afro Gypsy
6.subtitle: I create jewelry and accessories that enhance the uniqueness of you; we like to call it Bohemian with an AFRO-tude! My work predominantly consist of leather and metalwork items. But, considering my love for the extraordinary, you may stumble upon many other new or vintage items that could steal your heart!

products.name: Large Amethyst Pendant Necklace
products.description: Hand wired Large Amethyst pendant necklace with 14K Antiqued GP chain and findings.

7.title: Sienna Sauce
7.subtitle: The award winning Sienna Sauce comes in 3 delicious flavors for every palette. Tangy (the original flavor), Lemon Pepper and Spicy. The Lemon Pepper and Spicy flavors are made with the original flavor being the base of those Sauces. Sienna Sauce has WOWed so many customers, the family based company had to create a subscription program so the Sienna Sauce addicts wouldn’t run out of their favorite sauces.

products.name: Sienna Sauce Variety Pack
products.description: This gourmet sauce has No High Fructose Corn Syrup and is Gluten-Free. It combines the perfect blend of sweet with a hint of tangy serving as a perfect complement to chicken, pork, beef, or seafood that has been fried, smoked, baked, or grilled.

products.name: Sienna Sauce 3 Pack
products.description: This gourmet sauce has No High Fructose Corn Syrup and is Gluten-Free. It combines the perfect blend of sweet with a hint of tangy serving as a perfect complement to chicken, pork, beef, or seafood that has been fried, smoked, baked, or grilled.

products.name: Digital Sauce Lovers E-Book
products.description: Sienna Sauce has released its first e-cookbook! This digital flavor manual has 4 amazing recipes by celebrity chef, Jabril Riddick, Along with the champion recipe from Sienna Sauce's Virtual Cook-Off.

7.title: Charge the cops who shot Jacob Blake
7.subtitle: Jacob Blake, 29, was shot by Kenosha, Wisconsin police officers in the back 7 times on August 23, 2020. Officers were on the scene due to a fight, which Jacob Blake was trying to break up. The cops who shot him need to be charged.

8.title: Here Are the 18 African-American Astronauts
8.subtitle: It was 22 years after Alan Shepard’s first space trip that the U.S. sent a person of color up.

8.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
8.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

9.title: Build for Black Lives
9.subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

9.title: How colorism shapes our standards of beauty
9.subtitle: When Chika Okoro read the casting call for one of her favorite films, she noticed that actresses with darker skin were assigned lesser roles — prompting her to address a phenomenon she'd experienced all her life: colorism. In this eye-opening talk, Okoro shares coping strategies along with steps that could help eliminate this insidious and destructive mindset of discrimination.

10.title: Smile Natural Products
10.subtitle: After struggling to find an ethical, big-brand hygiene company, Founder and Chief Executive Officer Brian Mays decided to create one with Smile Natural Products.

products.name: Toothpaste Sampler Pack
products.description: Can't choose? Try all four toothpaste flavors and find your favorite! Mint + Charcoal, Cinnamon + Clove, Vanilla + Lavender, Ginger + Turmeric

products.name: Aromatherapy Diffuser
products.description: The Aromatherapy Diffuser scents your home to your mood!  Add our 100%, pure essential oils to this handmade, ceramic diffuser to freshen up any room in your home.

products.name: Lavender Essential Oil
products.description: Bulgarian Lavender Essential Oil is a common favorite in aromatherapy use. Lavender is well known for its calming properties, as well as being the most versatile essential oil out there.

10.title: Derek Chauvin Is Sentenced To 22 1/2 Years For George Floyd's Murder
10.subtitle: A Minnesota judge sentenced Derek Chauvin to 22 1/2 years in prison for the murder of George Floyd — a punishment that exceeds the state's minimum guidelines but falls short of prosecutors' request of a 30-year sentence.

11.title: Book: Understanding Mass Incarceration
11.subtitle: A People's Guide to the Key Civil Rights Struggle of Our Time

11.title: Code Switch Podcast
11.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

12.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
12.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

12.title: The Honey Pot Company
12.subtitle: Stay clean, fresh, and balanced, even during your period with our natural menstrual products. Banish bacteria and cramps with herbal-infused, chemical-free sanitary pads and tampons that create a "cooling" effect that’s both protective and soothing.

products.name: Menstrual Cup
products.description: If tampons or pads aren't your "cup" of tea, reach for the Honey Pot Co Menstrual Cup: a convenient, sustainable alternative that's good for you and the earth.

products.name: Mommy-to-Be Wash
products.description: Use our feminine hygiene wash during pregnancy to balance your pH, fight odor-causing bacteria, and calm discomfort while gently cleansing your honeypot.

products.name: Soothing Body Balm
products.description: This body salve is infused with natural magnesium for menstrual cramps and 500 mg of broad-spectrum hemp distillate. This hemp and magnesium body balm does not contain THC.

13.title: Sha'Carri Richardson's drug test suspension is the end result of racist policies
13.subtitle: Sha’Carri Richardson should have been spending the next month preparing to win the Olympic gold medal in the 100-meter dash. She had a shot after blazing through the event’s qualifying race last month in under 11 seconds. Instead, Richardson may not get to run at all in Tokyo after failing a drug test taken during the Olympic trials in Oregon. But it wasn’t a performance-enhancer that was in her system: It was marijuana.

13.title: Tyre Nichols remembered as beautiful soul with creative eye
13.subtitle: On most weekends, Tyre Nichols would head to the city park, train his camera on the sky and wait for the sun to set. Learn more in this article from the Associated Press.

14.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
14.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

14.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
14.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

15.title: Ashay by the Bay
15.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

15.title: Color blind or color brave?
15.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

16.title: Big Mama's Sauce
16.subtitle: We believe that to be the best we must use only the best ingredients. This homemade recipe has been the highlight of our family gatherings since at least 2002…honestly Big Mama can’t even remember, that’s how long she been making it! Big Mama never liked store bought sauce and she wanted to serve only the best to her loved ones. So here we are…on the store shelf ironically! Lol…We hope you taste only love and enjoy just as our family has for all of these years!

16.title: AllGoudes & Services
16.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

17.title: Biased: Uncovering the Hidden Prejudice That Shapes What We See, Think, and Do
17.subtitle: With a perspective that is at once scientific, investigative, and informed by personal experience, Dr. Jennifer Eberhardt offers us the language and courage we need to face one of the biggest and most troubling issues of our time.

17.title: Remembering Henry Lewis, first Black conductor of a major symphony orchestra
17.subtitle: Henry Lewis’ love and passion for music and symphony was indescribable.

18.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
18.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

18.title: Amanda Gorman Inauguration Poem
18.subtitle: Watch and read the youngest poet laureate, Amanda Gorman, recite her poem "The Hill We Climb"

19.title: 13th Amendment
19.subtitle: The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1865 in the aftermath of the Civil War, abolished slavery in the United States.

19.title: Coily and Cute
19.subtitle: Sharee has loved art all her life and has taken every opportunity to study it. She runs one of the Black-owned companies where customers can buy art prints.

20.title: Beyond the Numbers: The Experiential Effects of Stereotype Threat on Students of Color at TCU
20.subtitle: This study aims to examine if and how the effects of negative stereotypes of students of color are felt beyond the statistical measures of academic success, reaching into the classroom and social experiences of these students.

20.title: Pod For The Cause Podcast
20.subtitle: The Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights launched "Pod for the Cause" to expand the conversation on the critical civil and human rights challenges of our day. Through this expanded dialogue, we want to spur activism that drives change in our communities and country.

21.title: Brown v. Board: Timeline of School Integration in the U.S.
21.subtitle: Trace school integration from 1849 to 2007.

21.title: The Bail Project
21.subtitle: The Bail Project™ National Revolving Bail Fund is on a mission to combat mass incarceration and reshape the pretrial system in the United States. 100% of online donations are used to bring people home. Since bail money comes back to us when cases close, we're able to recycle every dollar donated at least twice per year.

22.title: The Weave Zone

products.name: Toni Danaé

products.name: GLAM Lashes
products.description: Add vibrancy to your finished look with a pair of GLAM lashes!

22.title: How we're honoring people overlooked by history
22.subtitle: Since its founding in 1851, the "New York Times" has published thousands of obituaries — for heads of state, famous celebrities, even the inventor of the sock puppet. But only a small percentage of them chronicle the lives of women and people of color. In this insightful talk, "Times" editor Amy Padnani shares the story behind "Overlooked," the project she's leading to recognize people from history whose deaths were ignored — and refocus society's lens on who is considered important.

23.title: Microaggressions Are A Big Deal: How To Talk Them Out And When To Walk Away
23.subtitle: Microaggressions are defined as the everyday, subtle, intentional — and oftentimes unintentional — interactions or behaviors that communicate some sort of bias toward historically marginalized groups. Learn more in this podcast from NPR.

23.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
23.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

24.title: How we're priming some kids for college — and others for prison
24.subtitle: In the United States, two institutions guide teenagers on the journey to adulthood: college and prison. Sociologist Alice Goffman spent six years in a troubled Philadelphia neighborhood and saw first-hand how teenagers of African-American and Latino backgrounds are funneled down the path to prison — sometimes starting with relatively minor infractions. In an impassioned talk she asks, "Why are we offering only handcuffs and jail time?"

24.title: Naja Tea
24.subtitle: At Naja Tea, we stand for quality, integrity, and curiosity. We strive daily to maintain high standards in every aspect of our business. Our mission is to provide a positive, significant, and sensational experience with Naja Tea.

products.name: English Breakfast Tea

products.name: Brew-In-Cup with Stainless Infuser & Lid
products.description: A simple design to enjoy loose leaf tea by the cup. Lucidity Brew-in-Cup is a wonderful addition to home and office.

products.name: Biscotti Bites
products.description: A traditional Biscotti recipe modernized using organic, wholesome ingredients and served in smaller, melt-in-your-mouth, bite-sized pieces.

products.name: Single Rod Holder Attachment

25.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
25.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

26.title: It’s Nola
26.subtitle: Reimagined healthy granola snack bites rolled into a ball for easy snacking pleasure. Bold flavor to match our bold Brooklyn lifestyle.

26.title: 3 Drs. & A Plan
26.subtitle:
3 Drs. & A Plan was created out of the drive to help goal-driven educators pursue their dreams. You have a bright future ahead of you but you may not know the right steps to take or how to get started. With our trained life coaches and educational career advisors, we will help you set attainable goals and create the right plan to make your hopes and wishes come true. 

As a life coach and career consultant, we help teachers deal with issues on an individual basis and determine the proper strategy for their needs.

27.title: The police who killed Tyre Nichols were Black. But they might still have been driven by racism
27.subtitle: CNN's Van Jones puts his thoughts to paper in this opinion piece in the role racism played in the killing of Tyre Nichols at the hands of 5 Black police officers in Memphis.

27.title: How Negro History Week Became Black History Month and Why It Matters Now
27.subtitle: Black History Month has been celebrated in the United States for close to 100 years. But what is it, exactly, and how did it begin?

28.title: Black Lives Matter
28.subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

28.title: Book: Tell Me Who You Are
28.subtitle: A roadmap for cultivation racial literacy by Winona Guo and Priya Vulchi

29.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
29.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

30.title: Understanding My Privilege
30.subtitle: University Chancellor, Susan E. Borrego, reflects on her life as an emancipated minor and dissects the emotionally charged conversation surrounding race relations in the United States. This raconteur uses her powerful first-person account of "White Privilege" and "Black Lives Matter" to underscore the responsibility each one of us has to bring about change.

30.title: Esusu
30.subtitle: Forbes Under 30 social entrepreneurs, Nigerian-born entrepreneur Wemimo and his business partner Goel co-founded Esusu in 2019. The mobile platform helps individuals mostly from marginalized communities save money, access capital and build credit.

31.title: Kintu New York
31.subtitle: Kintu handbags are designed in New York, co-developed with global artisans, and made in Italy. The Kintu brand appeals to the dynamic, busy, urban woman who values quality and self-expression.

31.title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
31.subtitle: Baratunde Thurston explores the phenomenon of white Americans calling the police on black Americans who have committed the crimes of ... eating, walking or generally "living while black." In this profound, thought-provoking and often hilarious talk, he reveals the power of language to change stories of trauma into stories of healing — while challenging us all to level up.
